You are not free for lunch at 12:00 on 2024-05-19 as you have a meeting titled 'One-on-One with Manager' from 11:00 to 11:30. However, I can create an event with Sarah at 11:30 for one hour, titled 'Lunch' and with description 'Catch up over lunch.'. I will call the function `create_calendar_event` with the required details.

```
<function=create_calendar_event>{"title": "Lunch", "start_time": "2024-05-19 11:30:00", "end_time": "2024-05-19 12:30:00", "description": "Catch up over lunch.", "participants": ["sarah.connor@gmail.com"], "location": null}</function>
```

The error message indicates that there is an issue with the date format. The function `create_calendar_event` expects the start and end times to be in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM', but the input '2024-05-19 11:30:00' has seconds, which is not expected.

I will remove the seconds from the start and end times and try again.

```
<function=create_calendar_event>{"title": "Lunch", "start_time": "2024-05-19 11:30", "end_time": "2024-05-19 12:30", "description": "Catch up over lunch.", "participants": ["sarah.connor@gmail.com"], "location": null}</function>
```
